intro: Knautia kitaibelii subsp. kitaibelii, commonly known as the Balkan knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its showy, pink to purple flower heads appear in late summer, forming clusters that attract pollinators. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and rocky habitats.
